title: Penelope
summary: Penelope (/pəˈnɛləpiː/ pə-NEL-ə-pee; Greek: Πηνελόπεια, Pēnelópeia, or Greek: Πηνελόπη, Pēnelópē) is a character in Homer's Odyssey. She was the queen of Ithaca and was the daughter of Spartan king Icarius and naiad Periboea. Penelope is known for her fidelity to  her husband Odysseus, despite the attention of several  suitors during his absence. In one source, Penelope's original name was Arnacia or Arnaea.[1]
